p.a: Click here for updates on our extended closure including lessons

li.a: See it, Say it, Safe Line!

a.style: color: White; text-decoration: none !important; line-height: 1; margin-top: 8px;

li.a: Information for Families of Students with Disabilities

span.div: The Ohio House of Representatives extended the vote by mail deadline for the March 17 primary election to April 28. As you know, Euclid City Schools has Issue 27 on the ballot. This critical levy provides our schools with the resources needed to continue our students’ academic growth.

Many of you have already voted early, and your vote will indeed count. If you have not yet cast a ballot, you will be able to vote by mail until April 28. Click on the Primary Election link for more information.

Euclid City Schools buidings are closed through the remainder of the school year in compliance with Ohio Gov. Mike DeWine's order related to the Coronavirus. Students are asked to complete learning at home during this period.

All district buildings and facilities, including outside facilities, are currently closed. All school events, travel, and extra-curricular athletics and clubs are suspended until further direction from the Governor. the Ohio Department of Education and the Ohio High School Athletic Association. Any request for access is to be directed to Pat Higley at [email protected].
Please use this website section as a resource during our extended school closure. Click on the following categories to find the information that you need.

strong.span: Information for Families of Students with Disabilities

span.div: To help facilitate more efficient communication between teachers and students, we will be enabling student email accounts for students in grades 6-12, beginning Monday April 6. Click the link above to learn more.

The registration department will re-open once the school buildings are able to open. Registrations for the 19-20 school year can be completed online by visiting our online registration section, however the appointment calendar will remain closed while the school buildings are closed. If you have further questions, feel free to contact Gina Rashad at [email protected].

Please contact via email Sherell Benton (PK-5) at [email protected] or Tajuana Hunnicutt (6-12) at [email protected] for any questions related to Special Education Services, Section 504 Plans, children in foster-care, families in transition, health services or registration.
Family liaisons and guidance counselors are available via email during school hours. 24/7 Community Mental Health Resources are listed in the column to the right.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

span.span: The tentative date for prom is June 19 and for commencement is June 24 (commencement rain day June 26) with the assumption that Governor DeWine will lift the stay at home order by the end of June. The location and time of each event will remain the same.

span.div: Due to the continued school closure mandate from the Governor, we are currently only accepting credit card payments for student fees. Payments can be made in the following methods:

- You may log into Infinite Campus and pay your student's outstanding fees through the Online Portal. Please be aware there is a minor convenience fee associated with this method to cover the costs of online merchant fees OR

- You may pay your student's outstanding fees over the phone at 216-797-7873 or contact Kathy Mowery at [email protected] to leave your contact information and she will follow up with a phone call as soon as possible.
Thank you in advance for your understanding.
Links to these resources are being provided to help you and your family over this period of uncertainty.
You may call either of these numbers if you would like to talk to someone about feeling stressed, anxious or overwhelmed.
Cuyahoga County Warm Line 440-886-5950 (staffed by trained community members)
SAMSHA Disaster Distress Helpline 800-985-5990 (800-846-8517 TTY) (staffed by mental health professionals)

Frontline Mobile Crisis Team 216-623-6888 (Call this number if you or someone you know is experiencing an emotional or behavioral health crisis, especially if the person’s safety or the safety of others is in danger.)

strong.span: Supporting Your Child's Health and Well-Being

span.div: The Ohio Department of Education offers suggestions on how to support your child over the extended closure.

ParenTeen Connect is a website that provides videos that show strategies to deal with some of the social, emotional and behavioral issues that families of middle schoolers face. https://www.parenteenconnect.org/

All central office and building level leaders are working from home throughout the closure. You may use their voicemail and/or email to communicate. Attached are lists of email addresses and phone numbers for our senior leadership team and building principals.

div.style: font-size: 14px; margin-bottom: 20px; color: #272727; font-family: liberation-sans, sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff

span.style: font-size: 14.6667px; color: #222222; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap

span.span: Teachers will be working from home throughout the closure. Part of their workday is to provide students with academic guidance and feedback for at-home student learning options.
